meta.hint:
Use 'is' if the sentence is about one person, animal, place, or, thing.example Richard is funny.example It is brittle.
Use 'are' if the sentence is about more than one person, animal, place or
thing. Also, use 'are' if the sentence is about you.example Jake and Ron are late.example We are behind you.example You are so pretty.
Use 'am' if the sentence is about I.example I am not going there.
meta.question: Complete the sentence with the correct present tense form.

content.description: Your books _____ scattered on the table.
